TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TransformerTypeCollection extends System.Collections.ReadOnlyCollectionBase

Docs.summary: Provides a read-only collection of objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> class represents a read-only collection of objects, typically used by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> objects to manage sets of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> objects.
A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> collection to keep a list of available <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> objects on a page, whereas a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> object uses a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> collection to track the available <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> objects that it contains.
Although the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> collection is read-only, you can make programmatic changes to the properties of the underlying controls referenced in the collection.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with no members in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Contains(class System.Type value) cil managed

Docs.param: A that is checked to determine whether it is in the collection.
Docs.summary: Returns a value indicating whether a particular transformer exists in the collection.
Docs.returns: A Boolean value that indicates whether a particular transformer is in the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to check a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> object and determine whether it is part of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> collection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (Type[] array, int index);
.method public hidebysig instance void CopyTo(class System.Type[] array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects to contain the copied collection.
The starting point in the array at which to place the collection contents.
Docs.summary: Copies the collection to an array of objects.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to assemble a custom array that can contain all the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer> objects in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> collection, a subset of those objects, or a superset of those objects.

Docs.summary: Creates a collection for storing transformers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection.Empty> field creates and returns a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection> object. The instance is created through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.TransformerTypeCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor and does not contain any existing members in the collection.
